TEST_NAME: Some fields benefit from an autocomplete attribute
QUERY_CLOB:
with aapi as (select case
                     when (lower(trim(aapi.html_form_element_attributes)) not like '%autocomplete%'
                           or trim(aapi.html_form_element_attributes) is null) 
                     then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
                   aapi.application_id,
                   aapi.application_name, 
                   aapi.page_id, 
                   aapi.page_name,
                   aapi.region, 
                   aapi.item_name,
                   aapi.html_form_element_attributes,
                   aapi.label,
                   aapi.workspace,
                   aapi.last_updated_by,
                   aapi.last_updated_on,
                   aapi.build_option,
                   aapi.item_help_text,
                   aapi.item_id,
                   aapi.display_as,
                   aapi.display_as_code,
                   esa.type_code
             from apex_application_page_items aapi
             inner join v_eba_stds_applications esa on esa.apex_app_id = aapi.application_id 
                                                    and esa.type_code = 'HUMANX'
             where aapi.display_as_code not in ('NATIVE_HIDDEN','NATIVE_CHECKBOX','NATIVE_SINGLE_CHECKBOX', 'NATIVE_RADIOGROUP','NATIVE_YES_NO')
						 and lower(aapi.item_name) not like '%api%'
             and (
                    (lower(aapi.label) like '%name%' 
                      and (lower(aapi.label) like '%first%' 
                      or lower(aapi.label) like '%last%' 
                      or lower(aapi.label) like '%family%'))
                    or 
                    (lower(aapi.label) like '%address%')
                    or 
                    (lower(aapi.label) like '%phone number%')
                    or 
                    (lower(aapi.label) like '%mail%')
                    or 
                    (lower(aapi.label) like '%birthday%' or lower(aapi.label) like '%bday%')
                 )
 )
select aapi.pass_yn,
       aapi.workspace workspace,
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapi.last_updated_by,
       aapi.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('`%3`/`%5` Page Item `%0`/`%4` (app %1, page %2, app type `%6`) could benefit from an autocomplete attribute', 
        p0 => aapi.item_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => aapi.display_as,
        p4 => aapi.label,
        p5 => aapi.display_as_code,
        p6 => aapi.type_code) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page Item `%0` (app %1, page %2) is missing autocomplete', 
        p0 => aapi.item_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) issue_title,
       aapi.item_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.item_name,
       aapi.item_help_text,
       aapi.display_as,
       aapi.display_as_code,
       aapi.label,
       aapi.type_code
from aapi
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id
                                      and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
EXPLANATION:
This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  1.3.5(AA) : Identify Input Purpose:
    
    The purpose of each input field collecting information about the user can be programmatically determined when:
    
    The input field serves a purpose identified in the Input Purposes for User Interface Components section; and  
    The content is implemented using technologies with support for identifying the expected meaning for form input data.
    

In the AHA environment, this test is only run against HUMANX applications
